SECRET.
G.T.5174
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 20th JULY, 1913.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front. According to information received this morning the situation last night was as follows:- East of REIMS heavy fighting took place near PRUNAY, between SOUAIN and AUBERIVE and in the neighbourhood of MASSIGES where the French have advanced slightly.
Between REIMS and the MARNE the French improved their line in certain places but the situation was generally unchanged. On the AISNE-SOISSONS Front the French advanced their line considerably in spite of severe hostile resistance and heavy counter-attacks. Last night the line ran as follows :- BELLEAU - West of MONTHIERS - SOMMELANS - 1500 yards East of NEUILLY-ST-FRONT - CHOUY thence uncertain to LE PLESS-IER HULEU - PARCY TIGNY - VILLEMONTOIRE - BERZY-LE-SEC - COURMELLES - MONTAGNE-DE-PARIS - PERNAN - FONTENOY. The captures on the battle front since the morning of the 18th amount to 18,940 prisoners and 364 guns. It is reported that the French are attacking this morning South-West of REIMS and on the CHATEAU THIERRY - SOISSONS front and are making good progress.
(b) British Front. The number of prisoners captured by us in the minor operation at METEREN amounts to 436. This operation was on a front of about 4,000 yards and both the village of METEREN and the group of buildings to the South-West of it are held by our Troops. South of HEBURTERNE we advanced our line on a front of about a mile. Hostile Artillery has been active in the neighbourhood of ST VENANT and YPRES.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS. There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
20th July, 1918.
Issued at 12.55 p.m.
